title: Reports page shows `oops` error after reopening the App

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem 1. User is on the Reports page and backgrounds the App 2. After a while (maybe a full 15min), user reopens the App 3. User sees the Oops error page ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/abe8a3f8-4b9f-4a65-9276-276b4d65c363) ### Solution Logs show the following: ``` Got an authorization error Expensify\Error\Auth\AuthTokenExpired - 9b953676-e64d-4262-bf74-1bf0ff888e4d ~~ command: 'Search' exceptionJsonCode: '407' exceptionUserMessage: 'Your session has expired. Please sign in again.' ``` The auth token is probably expiring and we're sending a request to Search before we re-authenticate the user, which leads to the request failing and the error showing. Make sure we re-authenticate first.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.67-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75831 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** iPhone 16 pro/26.1 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: Owner creates a workspace and invite member and approver 1. Open app 2. Employee submits expense in workspace chat 3. Employee goes offline 4. Approver at other device approves the expense 5. Employee retract and delete the expense 6. Employee goes back online 7. Employee taps on the expense 8. Employee taps on X button of error message 9. Employee scroll down to the end and tap on X button of error message 10. Employee tap back button for return to report preview ## Expected Result: Report preview should display without error ## Actual Result: Red dot is displayed on the report preview ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4b51e289-3aa6-4ab2-bcaa-d4160bc4c38d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.67-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2248/folder/13176710/41236945/1050638404 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Android **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: 1. Launch App Expensify 2. Navigate to a conversation 1:1 3. Tap on "+" and upload a "password protected PDF" 4. Tap on preview and "Enter password" 5. Write the password ## Expected Result: The app should open password-protected PDF files normally by prompting the user to enter the correct password, without crashing. ## Actual Result: The app immediately crashes when attempting to open a password-protected PDF, preventing the user from entering the password or viewing the file. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos [Password_protected Test12345.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/23872278/Password_protected.Test12345.pdf) [Bug7018131_1764647337953!Crash.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/23872264/Bug7018131_1764647337953.Crash.txt) https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56a7ee7d-f693-4f08-97cc-f566dfcd88e7 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Chat - User has to leave thread twice, to make the "Join Thread" option appear.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.67-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75826 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2134@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Send a message to chat. 4. Long tap on the message and select "Reply in thread" 5. Send any reply. 6. Return to conversation. 7. Long tap on the message. 8. Note that a "Leave Thread" option appears. 9. Tap on "Leave Thread" 10. Long tap on message again. 11. Note that "Leave Thread" option still appears, despite user having left the thread. 12. Tap on it again. 13. Long tap on message one more time. 14. Note that now, option changed to "Join Thread" ## Expected Result: "Leave Thread" option shouldn´t be available anymore after leaving the thread. Option in context menu should change to "Join Thread" after leaving. ## Actual Result: "Join Thread" option doesn´t appear on context menu until user leaves the thread twice, selecting the "Leave Thread" option. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/01b921d0-8aac-4a1f-9dd2-c21ceff52acc [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
